Faults.message:
We're aware of a power cut in the area shown, affecting 11 homes. This unplanned fault is affecting the local area, and it's likely several streets in the area are affected by the same power cut.

We have engineers on the way and they are due to arrive in your local area at 10:30 29/01/2025. Once they arrive, they will get straight to work on investigating the fault and attempt to restore your power. We will continue to update this message with any new information. At this stage, we're aiming to have your power restored by 16:00 29/01/2025.

The cause of this power cut is a fault on our overhead network. This is the most common type of fault we see, and our teams are very experienced in dealing with these issues. In most cases, our engineers are able to get your power back on by simply replacing a fuse at the local substation, however, if the fault is severe, this may take us longer to fix. If this does happen, we will let you know.

If you need more information, please send us a message on Whatsapp or call us on 105 and quote reference 'QG8408'
Faults.name: GU8 Area

Faults.message:
We're aware of a fault on our local network affecting several homes. This means that you and some of your neighbours will be affected by the power cut, but not all - this is why you may notice some of your neighbours have power when you do not. Its not uncommon to see 1 in 3 homes affected.

Our engineers are in your local area and working hard to get your power restored as soon as possible. At this stage, based on initial investigations, we're aiming to restore your power by . If this changes, we will update this message.

The cause of this power cut is a fault on our underground network. This is the most common type of fault we see, and our teams are very experienced in dealing with these issues. In most cases, our engineers are able to get your power back on by simply replacing a fuse at the local substation, however, if the fault is severe, this may take us longer to fix. If this does happen, we will let you know.

If you need more information, please send us a message on Whatsapp or call us on 105 and quote reference 'QG8434'
Faults.name: HP8 Area

Faults.message:
We're aware of a fault on our local network affecting several homes. This means that you and some of your neighbours will be affected by the power cut, but not all - this is why you may notice some of your neighbours have power when you do not. Its not uncommon to see 1 in 3 homes affected.

Our engineers are in your local area and working hard to get your power restored as soon as possible. At this stage, based on initial investigations, we're aiming to restore your power by 15:00 29/01/2025. If this changes, we will update this message.

We have had reports of damage to our network. When this happens, the power will automatically turn off to keep everyone safe. Our engineers know exactly where the problem is and are working hard to make the situation safe, repair the wire and get your power back on. These type of faults often require extensive work and specialist teams, such as tree cutters, which is why the restoration time seems so far away. If we can restore power sooner, we promise we will do so.

If you need more information, please send us a message on Whatsapp or call us on 105 and quote reference 'QG8423'

Faults.name: W13 & W3 Areas

Faults.message:
We're still working hard to get power restored to customers impacted by this fault.

Our engineers have been working around the clock since the storm hit our network earlier on in the weekend, and throughout the last 24 hours have been able to get power back on to a large number of areas. Our team of hundreds of engineers are still out throughout today in the last sprint effort to get every home and business back on power.

We're aiming to have power restored to almost every property by the end of the day on Monday. The damage to our network is severe and, in some cases, our engineers are needing to rebuild whole parts of the network which is why it's taken so long to get your power back on. We know some customers have been without power for some time now but we promise we're doing everything in our power to get things sorted sooner. We won't be standing down our teams until every single customer has their power back on.

As offered over the weekend, our support services including food reimbursement, welfare units, warm hubs and accommodation remain on offer for you. All the information about this can be found at www.ssen.co.uk/stormsupport/.

The best place to keep track of live updates is right here on PowerTrack, and this will be the fastest way to get the latest information about your power cut - it's updated in real time, so if you register for updates here, you'll get notified the moment anything changes.

If you're struggling at all or have any medical concerns without electricity, please call us on 105 and a member of the team will be happy to help.

Once again, we're so sorry for the power cut and will do everything we can to fix this as quickly and safely as possible. Thank you so much for your patience and support while we work to get your power back on.
Faults.name: PA21 & PA23 Areas

Faults.message:
We're still working hard to get power restored to customers impacted by this fault.

Our engineers have been working around the clock since the storm hit our network earlier on in the weekend, and have been able to restore power to the majority of customers impacted by the storm. Customers on the Isle of Gigha remain without power, however, our teams will be working relentlessly today to get the power back on as soon as they can.

We're still on track to get the power restored today and would like to thank customers for their ongoing patience, understanding and support.

We have arranged for the Welfare Wee Isle Café, Craft Workshop 1, Isle of Gigha PA41 7AA to open today from 1pm - 6pm and they are on hand to provide a warm space, food and drink to customers impacted by the power cut. If you need any extra support, please call us on 105.
